page.title: 07Easington Junior School
page.content: Our school was opened on February 26th 1914 & is similar to the Infants School opposite. It is one of the biggest buildings in Easington Colliery. There are 321 children & 11 classes. On leaving our school you go to Easington Comprehensive.The opening of our school in 19l4 was described by a local newspaper."The new school which is one of the largest in the district will eventually seat 1700 pupils. Separate accomodation is provided for domestic science & manual instruction & there is a house for the caretaker. The total cost of the building will be Â£20,576 4s 8d or Â£12.2s per pupil. This was thought to be extremely reasonable for the chara- cter of the accomodation provided" In 1985 the domestic science room was demolished & the caretaker lives off the premises. Recently redecorated.
